history.content:
I haven't taken ieor 135, but it is very practical from what I've read from other people online + looking at GitHub repos of past final projects from it. I have taken Data 100 which is a nice balance b/w theory and practical stuff since lectures are practical when it comes to visualization and data cleaning but they do more theory when it comes to ML (not as much as 189 though) and yet all the assignments/projects are coding-focused (you even do 2 class-wide Kaggle contests). I hope that helps!

Also, I'm not aware of a piazza forum for IEOR :/

Data 100 is a nice balance b/w theory and practical stuff since lectures are practical when it comes to visualization and data cleaning but they do more theory when it comes to ML (not as much as 189 though) and yet all the assignments/projects are coding-focused (you even do 2 class-wide Kaggle contests). I hope that helps!

Also, I'm not aware of a piazza forum for IEOR :/

Hi all, I'm currently taking 189 and although i think it is a great class, I feel detached from the real world in terms of applying my knowledge. I've always been a more hands-on person and I love building apps. I was wondering what courses are suitable for me in terms of real-world applications of ML/DL. I'm currently considering IEOR 135 but it is completely full. I'm also enrolled in Data 100 for next semester but i'm not quite sure how real-world application is this class. I heard that IEOR has several hands-on data science courses, so if anyone has taken any of them, could you recommend them? 

Thank you!

P.s. Is there a piazza forum like EECS101 but for IEOR classes?
history.subject: Applied ML class
